comment.author: 35317829@N06
comment._content:
The passenger liner is either the Moldavia or the Mongolia. It's definitely pre-1930 (Moldavia received a dummy second funnel during this time). There's also a strong chance this photo is pre-1928 because after that time the white stripe along the hull was moved a deck lower.
For reference, see p154 of Malcolm Gordon's book 'From Chusan to Sea Princess'.
Cheers,
Phill

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/35317829@N06] Woo hoo!  We have met the MOLDAVIA before at Circular Quay in 1931, with the high stripe.  Interesting to compare - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/33147718@N05/7586819828/]
